title: Cabinets Of Curiosities - Lessons from the Wunderkammer (Book Review) Texture, Objects, Art, Museums
description:
Welcome to the strange world of the Wunderkammer or the Cabinet of Curiosities. During the Baroque Era rooms, halls, chambers were created to exhibit strange collections of oddities, shapes, wonders from both the natural world and from the genius of humanity. These were places of mystery and surprise. And though they seem like long lost ephemera in course of history, this practice a rich cultured few has something to teach each of us today. I present to you a book review of Patrick Mauriés book Cabinets Of Curiosities.
.....

https://gravityfromabove.wordpress.com/ 

And to understand more about my life in Georgia check out my Georgian Crossroads channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeFJ6Tm71ieNcjcUb-Trc8g

And if you want to communicate with me use The Anadromous Life Facebook page. https://www.facebook.com/theanadromist/ 
(I don't want to have to make my personal page private because I have too many 'friends'. If it's dialogue you want go there. I'll start 'community' page soon enough if the demand is there.) 

Thanks for watching, more coming soon! 

Meanwhile dig into the Anadromous past. 
From Tbilisi Georgia (Look it up on a map!) 
Swimming Against the Stream
Byrne


#cabinetofcuriosities #wunderkammer #baroque
